page.title: 16COUNTRIES LEISURE ACTIVITIES
page.content: RARE BREED REARING AT WOODSEATS. PIGS_Gloucester Old Spots_this is a white pig with black spots.It is a docile,lean & hardy pig which produces fine streaky bacon.They are also known as the Orchard pig as they love to live in orchards & eat windfalls. SHEEP_Cotswold_a white faced sheep.These were popular when wool was a major industry here.They are now rare because of man_made fibres & also because they are a big sheep & have too much fat meat not liked by the public. _Tordu_This is a small hardy breed from Wales.IT is also known as the Badger because of its face which is rown with black marks over the eyes. All the wool on the belly & under the tail is black.They are wild but make very tender eating when finished.
